0P00000DWN.F.manager_bio: Marcus Stahlhacke is Head of Retail Active Allocation in Allianz Global Investors Multi Asset Europe and is also Team Lead of the Retail Multi Channel team therein. He joined the company in 1996 as portfolio manager for balanced portfolios. He was Head of Fixed Income / Benchmark Analysis from 1998 for several years before being appointed as Senior Product Advisor of the Product Advisory division in November 2001. From 2005 to 2010 Marcus Stahlhacke was CIO Systematic Multi Asset-Multi Manager and headed the Fund-of-Funds team. Prior to joining the Multi Asset - Active Allocation team in February 2012, Marcus was CIO - Real Estate Private Clients at Allianz Global Investors. Marcus studied at the universities of Frankfurt und Southampton, graduating in Economics (âDiplom-Volkswirtâ) and Business Administration (âDiplom -Kaufmannâ). Following his graduation, Marcus worked as a research assistant at the University of Frankfurt before moving to a management consultancy ï¬rm. Marcus qualiï¬ed as a CFA charterholder in 2009 and as a Financial Risk Manager (FRM) in 2002. He further qualiï¬ed as a Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA) in 2012.

0P000162RA.F.summary: The investment objective of the Fund is to generate capital growth by investing in an internationally diversified portfolio of shares and units in collective investment schemes and individual high quality fixed interest instruments.
0P000162RA.F.manager_bio: Mark is an Investment Director at Collins Stewart. He is part of the multi-manager team providing discretionary portfolio management to institutions, intermediaries and private clients. In addition, Mark is Chairman of Collins Stewart Wealth Management's Fund Selection Committee and co-manages several of the group's Select range of multi-manager, multi-asset funds. Mark is a Chartered Fellow of the Chartered Institute for Securities and Investment. Prior to joining Collins Stewart in September 1998, he spent 10 years at Old Mutual International where his responsibilities included the management of their Elite offshore fund umbrella, as well as a selection of private client portfolios and life funds.

ACAGLO.MI.summary: Investimento principale in strumenti finanziari rappresentativi del capitale di rischio. Investimento residuale in OICR, anche promossi e/o gestiti dalla SGR (OICR collegati). PossibilitÃ  di investimento in depositi bancari in misura residuale. Gli investimenti sono denominati in euro e nelle valute dei principali paesi di riferimento.
ACAGLO.MI.manager_bio: Laureato in Economia e Finanza presso lâUniversitÃ  degli Studi di Milano Bicocca, entra in Kairos a gennaio 2008, specializzandosi nei mercati del credito area Euro, nei mercati governativi dei paesi emergenti, oltre che nella selezione dei titoli del mercato monetario per i due fondi di liquiditÃ  e nella ottimizzazione della tesoreria dei fondi fixed income.

ASNZO.AS.summary: Het doel van het ASN Duurzaam Mixfonds Zeer Offensief is om via beleggingsinstellingen te beleggen in beursgenoteerde en niet-beursgenoteerde aandelen, obligaties en onderhandse leningen. Deze financiÃ«le instrumenten moeten zijn uitgegeven door ondernemingen, organisaties en overheden die voldoen aan de ASN Duurzaamheidscriteria van ASN Beleggingsfondsen N.V. Per beleggingsinstelling gelden er bandbreedtes waarbinnen belegd mag worden. Het beleggingsbeleid van het ASN Duurzaam Mixfonds Zeer Offensief is gericht op vermogensgroei op de lange termijn.

AVMO.AS.summary:
The investment objective is to achieve a return at least equal to the composite benchmark and at the same time to realise an ESG score for the fund that is as high as possible. The benchmark consists of: 25% of the composite benchmark of Euro Obligatiepool, 65% of the composite benchmark of Global Equity Mixpool and 10% GPR Sustainable Real Estate Index Europe.
Investment policy.
 ACTIAM Duurzaam Mixfonds Offensief invests in bonds and listed equities/real estate. The fund does not pursue its own foreign exchange policy. This is done in the underlying investment pools.
 Companies, governments and institutions in the fund are assessed on their environmental, social and governance performance (ESG criteria). A negative assessment may lead to the exclusion of companies or debtors. In case of doubt, engagement can be initiated to encourage improvement.
